title: Are naked mole rats the strangest mammals? - Thomas Park

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way naked mole rats regulate their body temperature?

options.text: Their body temperature fluctuates with their environment.

options.label: C
options.text: They can only survive in environments with a narrow temperature range.

options.label: D
options.text: They are able to generate heat internally to maintain a constant body temperature.

options.label: B
options.text: To increase their chances of finding food.

options.label: C
options.text: To maintain a stable body temperature.

options.label: B
options.text: She is the only female in the colony who has babies.

options.label: C
options.text: She is responsible for foraging for food.

options.label: D
options.text: She is responsible for maintaining the colony's tunnel system.

multiple-choice.question: How do naked mole rats adapt to low oxygen levels in their underground tunnels?

options.label: A
options.text: They increase their heart rate to pump more oxygen to their cells.

options.label: B
options.text: They abandon thermoregulation and use a special type of hemoglobin to pick up oxygen.

options.label: C
options.text: They reduce their activity levels to conserve energy.

options.label: D
options.text: They use a different type of sugar to produce energy.

options.label: B
options.text: They use fructose to produce energy, like plants.

options.label: C
options.text: They use a combination of glucose and fructose to produce energy.

options.label: D
options.text: They are unable to produce energy in low oxygen conditions.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it beneficial for naked mole rats to be able to metabolize fructose in low oxygen conditions?

options.label: A
options.text: Fructose produces more energy than glucose.

options.label: B
options.text: Fructose can be used to produce energy without burning oxygen.

options.label: C
options.text: Fructose is more readily available in their environment.

options.label: D
options.text: Fructose is easier to digest than glucose.

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential application of studying the naked mole rat's ability to metabolize fructose in low oxygen conditions?

options.label: A
options.text: Developing new treatments for heart attacks and other medical emergencies.

options.label: B
options.text: Improving our understanding of insect social behavior.

options.label: C
options.text: Developing new methods for regulating body temperature.

options.label: D
options.text: Improving our understanding of plant metabolism.

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: They abandon their underground tunnels and move to the surface.

options.label: D
options.text: They use a different type of sugar to produce energy.

options.label: A
options.text: They have a dominant male who leads the colony.

options.label: B
options.text: They have a rigid social hierarchy with a dominant female and different castes.

options.label: C
options.text: They have a fluid social hierarchy with no dominant individual.

options.label: D
options.text: They are solitary animals and do not live in colonies.

options.label: B
options.text: Their ability to metabolize fructose in low oxygen conditions.

options.label: C

title: Why tech needs the humanities

multiple-choice.question: What was the initial problem faced by the speaker's software consulting firm?

options.text: They had a lack of engineers.

options.label: D
options.text: They were struggling to communicate with their clients.

options.text: They hired a new team of engineers.

options.label: B
options.text: They sent their bartender friend, Jeff, to work with the client.

options.label: C
options.text: They changed their recruitment strategy to only hire computer science majors.

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: The client decided to use a different consulting firm.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They changed their recruitment strategy to include people from diverse backgrounds, such as artists, musicians, and writers.

options.label: C
options.text: They fired all their engineers and replaced them with philosophers.

options.label: D
options.text: They stopped working with clients who required specific programming skills.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's opinion on the emphasis on STEM education in the United States?

options.label: A
options.text: The speaker believes that STEM education is the key to the future and that all students should pursue STEM fields.

options.label: B
options.text: The speaker thinks that the emphasis on STEM education is overblown and that the humanities are equally important.

options.label: C
options.text: The speaker believes that STEM education is only necessary for certain fields, such as engineering and computer science.

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker thinks that STEM education is a waste of time and that students should only pursue the humanities.

multiple-choice.question: What are the two reasons the speaker gives for why we shouldn't overvalue STEM education?

options.label: A
options.text: The speaker argues that STEM education is too expensive and that it's not relevant to the modern workforce.

options.label: B
options.text: The speaker argues that modern systems can be manipulated without writing code and that the skills that are imperative in a world with intuitive technology are the skills that help us work together as humans.

options.label: C
options.text: The speaker argues that STEM education is only necessary for certain fields and that the humanities are more important for other fields.

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker argues that STEM education is a waste of time and that students should only pursue the humanities.

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of open job opportunities at tech companies like Google, Apple, and Facebook are non-technical?

options.label: A
options.text: The speaker believes that the most important thing is for everyone to pursue STEM fields.

options.label: B
options.text: The speaker believes that the most important thing is for the workforce to have a diversity of backgrounds and skills.

options.label: C
options.text: The speaker believes that the most important thing is for everyone to have a degree in computer science.

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker believes that the most important thing is for the workforce to be made up of only engineers.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's final message to the audience?

options.label: A
options.text: The speaker encourages the audience to pursue STEM fields at all costs.

options.label: B
options.text: The speaker encourages the audience to discourage their friends and family from pursuing the humanities.

options.label: C
options.text: The speaker encourages the audience to allow their friends and family to pursue whatever field they want, as the jobs will be there.

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker encourages the audience to only hire people with degrees in computer science.

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: What if you never forgot anything?
